study.intervention: 3% saline solution (2 ml) With 5 mg (0.5 ml) terbutaline via wet nebulized aerosol Every 8 hours for 5 days
study.comparison: 0.9% saline solution (2 ml) With 5 mg (0.5 ml) terbutaline via wet nebulized aerosol Every 8 hours for 5 days

study.intervention: 3% saline solution (4 ml) With 1.5 mg epinephrine via nebulized aerosol Every 8 hours until discharge
study.comparison: 0.9% saline solution (4 ml) With 1.5 mg epinephrine via nebulized aerosol Every 8 hours until discharge

study.intervention: 3% saline solution (4 ml) With 1.5 mg epinephrine via ultrasound nebulizer Every eight hours until discharge
study.comparison: 0.9% saline solution (4 ml) With 1.5 mg epinephrine via ultrasound nebulizer Every eight hours until discharge

study.intervention: 3% saline solution (4 ml) Every 2 hours for 3 doses tapered to every 6 hours until discharge via oxygen-driven hospital nebulizer
study.comparison: 0.9% saline solution (4 ml) Every 2 hours for 3 doses tapered to every 6 hours until discharge via oxygen-driven hospital nebulizer

study.intervention: 3% hypertonic saline (4 ml) With 1.5 mg of epinephrine or 2.5 mg of salbutamol via nebulization with 100% oxygen at 6l/min Repeated once after 30 minutes
study.comparison: 0.9% saline solution (4 ml) With 1.5 mg of epinephrine or 2.5 mg of salbutamol via nebulization with 100% oxygen at 6l/min Repeated once after 30 minutes

outcome.bullet: Bronchiolitis Severity Score (Wang, 1992). Like the Cochrane, **we could not extract these numbers, which were insignificant, for pooling**.

study.intervention: 3% hypertonic saline (2.5 ml) With 0.5 ml of 2.25% racemic epinephrine via nebulization with continous oxygen flow of 6l/min Repeated once if needed within 120 minutes
study.comparison: 0.9% saline solution (2.5 ml) With 0.5 ml of 2.25% racemic epinephrine via nebulization with continous oxygen flow of 6l/min Repeated once if needed within 120 minutes

outcome.bullet: Change in Respiratory distress assessment index (RDAI). Like the Cochrane, **we could not extract these numbers, which were insignificant, for pooling**.

study.intervention: 3% or 5% hypertonic saline (5 ml) With 1.5 ml of epinephrine via nebulization Every four hours until discharge
study.comparison: 0.9% normal saline (5 ml) With 1.5 ml of epinephrine via nebulization Every four hours until discharge

study.intervention: 3% hypertonic saline (4 ml) With 2.5 mg of salbutamol via air-compressed nebulizer Every 8 hours until discharge
study.comparison: 0.9% normal saline (4 ml) With 2.5 mg of salbutamol via air-compressed nebulizer Every 8 hours until discharge

study.intervention: 3% hypertonic saline (4 ml) Every 2 hours for 3 doses tapered to every 6 hours until discharge via nebulization
study.comparison: 0.9% normal saline (4 ml) Every 2 hours for 3 doses tapered to every 6 hours until discharge via nebulization

study.intervention: 3% hypertonic saline (4 ml) With or without salbutamol 0.15 mg/kg via a compressor nebulizer Every 20 minutes for three total doses
study.comparison: 0.9% normal saline (4 ml) With or without salbutamol 0.15 mg/kg via a compressor nebulizer Every 20 minutes for three total doses

study.intervention: 3% hypertonic saline (unclear dose) With 1.5 mg of epinephrine via nebulizer with continous oxygen flow at 6l/min Every 6 hours until discharge
study.comparison: 0.9% normal saline (unclear dose) With 1.5 mg of epinephrine via nebulizer with continous oxygen flow at 6l/min Every 6 hours until discharge

study.intervention: 3% hypertonic saline (4 ml) With 2.5 mg salbutamol via nebulization along with supplemental oxygen Every 4 hours until discharge
study.comparison: 0.9% normal saline (4 ml) With 2.5 mg salbutamol via nebulization along with supplemental oxygen Every 4 hours until discharge

intervention.bullet: With 0.5 mL 2.25% racemic epinephrine via nebulization along with supplemental oxygen
**Single dose** prior to repeat assessment and hospitalization decision; however continued every six hours until discharge

study.comparison: 0.9% normal saline (3 ml) With 0.5 mL 2.25% racemic epinephrine via nebulization along with supplemental oxygen **Single dose** prior to repeat assessment and hospitalization decision; however continued every six hours until discharge

outcome.bullet: Bronchiolitis Severity Score (Wang, 1992). **We could not extract these numbers, which were insignificant, for pooling.**

study.intervention: 3% hypertonic saline (4 ml) With albuterol sulfate via nebulization along with supplemental oxygen Every 8 hours until discharge
study.comparison: 0.9% normal saline (4 ml) With albuterol sulfate via nebulization along with supplemental oxygen Every 8 hours until discharge

study.intervention: 3% hypertonic saline (4 ml) With albuterol sulfate via jet nebulization with oxygen flow rate of 8l/min **Single dose** prior to repeat assessment and hospitalization decision; however continued every six hours until discharge
study.comparison: 0.9% normal saline (4 ml) With albuterol sulfate via jet nebulization with oxygen flow rate of 8l/min **Single dose** prior to repeat assessment and hospitalization decision; however continued every six hours until discharge
